lighten.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to reduce the amount of work, worry, debt etc that someone has
lighten.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: We should hire another secretary to lighten Barbara’s workload.
lighten.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to become brighter or less dark, or to make something brighter etc
lighten.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: As the sky lightened, we were able to see where we were.
lighten.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if you lighten something such as a mood or atmosphere, or if it lightens, it becomes less sad or serious
lighten.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Nora didn’t respond to my attempts to lighten the conversation.
lighten.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if someone’s face or expression lightens, they begin to look more cheerful
lighten.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: His whole face would lighten when anyone mentioned Nancy.
lighten.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to reduce the weight of something, or to become less heavy
